title: Job Openings at Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores
content:
Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores is a proudly Nigerian, multi-service retail brand committed to meeting the everyday needs of our customers through quality products, excellent service, and community-focused operations. We operate a unique combination of businesses under one roof, making us a convenient and trusted destination for families and individuals alike.

We are recruiting to fill the positions below:

1.) Driver

Job Locations: Gwarimpa, Gudu, Wuse, Lokogoma and Kubwa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are hiring experienced and reliable drivers to support our retail operations by ensuring safe and timely delivery of goods between branches, warehouses, and suppliers.
	The driver will also assist with receiving and verifying goods delivered to the store, ensuring accurate documentation and proper handling of items.


Key Responsibilities


	Transport goods, supplies, and store items safely between warehouse and retail branches.
	Assist the store receiving team during offloading, counting, and verification of incoming goods.
	Ensure delivery notes, invoices, and waybills are properly signed and filed after each trip.
	Conduct daily vehicle checks (oil, tires, fuel, water, lights) before and after use.
	Maintain accurate trip logs and report any maintenance needs or irregularities.
	Observe all traffic regulations and company safety policies.
	Support the logistics or warehouse team in moving goods within the store premises when required.
	Report promptly any damaged or missing items noticed during receiving or delivery.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of SSCE / OND certificate.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience driving for retail, logistics, or FMCG organizations.
	Valid driver’s license and good driving record.
	Familiarity with receiving and delivery documentation (delivery notes, waybills, stock transfer forms).
	Good knowledge of Abuja routes and neighboring areas.
	Physically fit and able to assist with light loading/unloading when needed.
	Punctual, trustworthy, and attentive to detail.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hiring436@gmail.com using “Driver – [Preferred Branch]” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

2.) Baker

Job Location: Kubwa, Gwarimpa - Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a skilled and passionate Baker to join our bakery team. The ideal candidate will have proven experience creating high-quality breads, pastries, cakes, and other baked goods in a fast-paced environment such as a bakery, hotel, restaurant, or catering establishment.
	You will be responsible for producing consistent products, maintaining quality standards, controlling costs, and supporting innovation in our bakery offerings.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and bake a wide range of breads, pastries, cakes, cookies, and other bakery items according to recipes and production schedules.
	Develop new recipes and innovate products that meet customer preferences and seasonal trends.
	Maintain high standards of product quality, taste, and presentation at all times.
	Monitor and manage ingredient inventory; ensure proper storage and rotation of raw materials.
	Ensure accurate measurement and portion control to minimize waste and manage costs.
	Maintain cleanliness, hygiene, and food safety standards in the bakery area.
	Operate, clean, and maintain baking equipment safely and efficiently.
	Work closely with management to plan production, forecast demand, and meet daily targets.
	Train and mentor junior bakery staff, where necessary.
	Collaborate with restaurant and retail teams to align bakery output with business needs.


Requirements


	Proven experience (minimum of 5 years) as a Baker in a bakery, hotel, restaurant, or catering environment.
	Strong knowledge of baking techniques, ingredients, and food safety standards.
	Ability to work with precision and meet deadlines in a fast-paced setting.
	Creativity and willingness to innovate with recipes and product presentations.
	Excellent time management, organization, and communication skills.
	Physical stamina and ability to stand for long hours.
	Certification or training in baking/pastry arts is an added advantage.


Salary
N150,000 monthly (negotiable, based on experience and skill level)

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter highlighting relevant experience to: hiring436@gmail.com using “Experienced Baker” as the subject line of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

3.) Loader

Job Location: Gwarimpa, Jahi - Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking reliable and physically fit Loaders to assist with the loading, unloading, and movement of goods within our retail and warehouse operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure that products are handled safely and efficiently to support smooth store and logistics activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Load and unload goods from delivery trucks, containers, and storage areas.
	Arrange and stack items safely on pallets, shelves, or designated areas.
	Assist drivers and inventory staff in verifying quantities during loading/unloading.
	Handle products with care to prevent damage or loss.
	Use basic handling equipment (pallet jacks, trolleys, etc.) where required.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of loading/unloading areas.
	Follow company safety procedures and wear the required protective gear.
	Report any damaged goods, shortages, or safety hazards promptly to supervisors.


Requirements & Skills


	Minimum of SSCE or equivalent.
	Previous experience in loading/unloading, warehouse, or logistics roles is an advantage.
	Physical fitness and the ability to lift heavy items safely.
	Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions.
	Good teamwork and communication skills.


Salary
N70,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV  or application to: hiring436@gmail.com using “Application for Loader Position” as the subject of the mail.

Confidential Secretary I Job at National Mathematical Centre




        
    

        
        The National Mathematical Centre Abuja was established by the Federal Government of Nigeria on January 1, 1988, although the decree (Decree No. 40) giving it a legal backing as a corporate body with perpetual succession and a common seal was not promulgated until December 12, 1989. The Centre was created to develop appropriate initiatives and resources of international standing for reawakening and sustaining interest in the mathematical sciences at all levels in Nigeria, and also as an adequate response to the dramatic decline in the production of teachers and specialists in the mathematical sciences at all levels.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Confidential Secretary I

Job Location: Abuja

Requirements


	Candidate must possess a B.Sc / HND or its equivalent in Secretarial Studies or Office Technology and Management from a recognized institution.
	He / she must equally possess either NYSC Discharge Certificate or Exemption Certificate.


Salary Grade
CONTISS 07.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Applications, including their Curriculum Vitae (CV) with a list of publications where applicable, to:
The Registrar,
National Mathematical Centre,
KM 34, Abuja - Lokoja Expressway,
Sheda Kwali,
P.M.B. 118,
Gwagwalada, Abuja.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
